Issues.Title: fix(core): fake_async_fallback should have the same logic with fake-async
Issues.Body:
PR #37523 failed when trying to use `rxjs delay` operator
inside `fakeAsync`, and the reasons are:

1. we need to import `rxjs-fake-async` patch to make the integration work.
2. since in `angular` repo, the bazel target `/tools/testing:node` not using `zone-testing` bundle,
instead it load `zone-spec` packages seperately, so it causes one issue which is the `zone.js/testing/fake-async`
package is not loaded, we do have a fallback logic under `packages/core/testing` calles `fake_async_fallback`,
but the logic is out of date with `fake-async` under `zone.js` package.
https://github.com/angular/angular/blob/master/packages/zone.js/lib/testing/fake-async.ts

So this PR, I updated the content of `fake_async_fallback` to make it consistent with
`fake-async`. And I will make another PR to try to remove the `fallback` logic.

And the `Angular` application will not have this issue since they all import `zone.js/dist/zone-testing`, only `angular repo` testing may have this issue.

Issues.Title: release(benchpress): bump version to v0.2.1 and update `@angular/core` peer dependency
Issues.Body:
Updates the version of `@angular/benchpress` to the next patch
version. i.e. `v0.2.1`. Additionally, the peer dependency
on `@angular/core` has been updated to be satisifed with
Angular v10 and v11.

Benchpress should be at least compatibe with the next two major
versions as it does not rely on any deprecated API from `@angular/core`.

**Note**: You might be wondering why this PR proposes the version bump. This is because
benchpress is not released as part of other framework packages, and after this PR being
merged, we should cut a manual release of benchpress with the new version.

Issues.Title: fix(router): ensure duplicate popstate/hashchange events are handled ‚Ä¶
Issues.Body:
‚Ä¶correctly

The current method of handling duplicate navigations caused by 'hashchange' and 'popstate' events for the same url change does not correctly handle cancelled navigations. Because `scheduleNavigation` is called in a `setTimeout` in the location change subscription, the duplicate navigations are not flushed at the same time. This means that if the initial navigation hits a guard that schedules a new navigation, the navigation for the duplicate event will not compare to the correct transition (because we inserted another navigation between the duplicates). See https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/16710#issuecomment-646919529

Fixes #16710
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(router): ensure duplicate popstate/hashchange events are handled ‚Ä¶" (#37674)

Issues.Title: NavigationStart event doesn't fire when browser back/forward button is used
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report

### Affected Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages as the source of the bug? -->
The issue is caused by package @angular/router



### Description

Browser back/forward doesn't fire NavigationStart event if the following conditions happen

1. Component navigating from has CanDeactivate guard
2. Navigating using router to the same component that the browser button would navigate to
3. Cancel the navigation using the guard
4. Navigate again to the same component using the browser button

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

https://stackblitz.com/edit/angular-ivy-s3hcel

**Scenario 1:**

1. Observe the console log with every navigation (NavigationStart event is being logged)
2. Click "Go to first"
3. Click "Go to Base"
4. Click "Cancel" in the confirmation message
5. Click the browser back button
6. NavigationStart event is not logged and the confirmation message is not shown and navigation doesn't happen
7. Browser URL is wrong (pointing on base component url), and browser history is messed up

**Scenario 2:**

1. Observe the console log with every navigation (NavigationStart event is being logged)
2. Click "Go to first"
3. Click "Go to Base"
4. Click "Cancel" in the confirmation message
5. Click "Go to Base" again
6. Click "OK" in the confirmation message
7. NavigationStart event is logged and the navigation happen

Browser button is expected to behave like the normal navigation using router.
Also the browser history get me

## üåç  Your Environment

Angular CLI: 9.1.9
Node: 12.18.1
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.1.11
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

-----------------------------------------------------------

@angular/flex-layout              9.0.0-beta.31

Issues.Title: perf(ngcc): use `EntryPointManifest` to speed up noop `ProgramBaseEntryPointFinder`
Issues.Body:
Previously the `ProgramBasedEntryPointFinder` was parsing all the
entry-points referenced by the program for dependencies even if all the
entry-points had been processed already.

Now this entry-point finder will re-use the `EntryPointManifest` to load
the entry-point dependencies when possible which avoids having to parse
them all again, on every invocation of ngcc.

Previously the `EntryPointManifest` was only used in the
`DirectoryWalkerEntryPointFinder`, which also contained the logic for
computing the contents of the manifest. This logic has been factored out
into an `EntryPointCollector` class. Both the `ProgramBasedEntryPointFinder`
and `DirectoryWalkerEntryPointFinder` now use the `EntryPointManifest` and
the `EntryPointCollector`.

The result of this change is that there is a small cost on the first run of
ngcc to compute and store the manifest - the processing takes 102% of the
processing time before this PR. But on subsequent runs there is a
significant benefit on subsequent runs - the processing takes around 50%
of the processing time before this PR.

---

Using the `super-productivity` as a test environment, we get the following
times for the "hot" (arguably noop) run of `ngcc` using the following command:

```bash
time node node_modules/.bin/ngcc --source node_modules --properties es2015 --first-only --create-ivy-entry-points --use-program-dependencies --async=false --tsconfig src/tsconfig.app.json
```

**Current master:**

(Last row is the average)

User time | System time | CPU usage | Total time
-- | -- | -- | --
2.93 | 0.75 | 106% | 3.465
2.74 | 0.61 | 119% | 2.811
2.8 | 0.62 | 120% | 2.835
2.76 | 0.61 | 119% | 2.818
2.74 | 0.61 | 120% | 2.777
**2.794** | **0.64** | **117%** | **2.9412**

**This PR:**

(Last row is the average)

User time | System time | CPU usage | Total time
-- | -- | -- | --
1.21 | 0.28 | 108% | 1.378
1.24 | 0.28 | 108% | 1.394
1.26 | 0.29 | 110% | 1.398
1.19 | 0.28 | 104% | 1.393
1.17 | 0.28 | 107% | 1.341
1.25 | 0.28 | 101% | 1.511
**1.22** | **0.28** | **106%** | **1.4025**

From these tables it can be seen that the noop (hot) run of ngcc drops from 2.94 to 1.4s (half the time).
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "perf(ngcc): use `EntryPointManifest` to speed up noop `ProgramBaseEntryPointFinder`" (#37665)

Issues.Title: Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'id' of undefined
Issues.Body:
# üêû bug report ### Affected Package packages/core/src/linker/ng_module_factory_registration.ts ```typescript export function registerNgModuleType(ngModuleType: NgModuleType) { // If id emod is undefined an error is thrown. if (ngModuleType.…µmod.id !== null) { ``` ### Is this a regression? No ### Description This line: ```typescript ngModuleType.…µmod.id !== null ``` Results in this: ```typescript Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'id' of undefined at registerNgModuleType (core.js:36228) at core.js:36246 at Array.forEach () at registerNgModuleType (core.js:36242) at core.js:36246 at Array.forEach () at registerNgModuleType (core.js:36242) at new NgModuleFactory$1 (core.js:36407) at compileNgModuleFactory__POST_R3__ (core.js:42296) at PlatformRef.bootstrapModule (core.js:42663) ``` Would be nice to catch the error and tell the user which module is failing. This was failing in the MatPaginator module. It is probably an incorrect import but not sure yet. I've written an [article](https://dev.to/jwp/uncaught-typeerror-cannot-read-property-id-of-undefined-5104) on the journey to determine root cause. ## üåç Your Environment **Angular Version:** 

Angular CLI: 9.1.8
Node: 12.18.0
OS: win32 x64

Angular: 9.1.11
... animations, common, compiler, compiler-cli, core, forms
... language-service, platform-browser, platform-browser-dynamic
... router
Ivy Workspace: Yes

Package                            Version
------------------------------------------------------------
@angular-devkit/architect          0.901.8
@angular-devkit/build-angular      0.901.8
@angular-devkit/build-ng-packagr   0.901.8
@angular-devkit/build-optimizer    0.901.8
@angular-devkit/build-webpack      0.901.8
@angular-devkit/core               9.1.8
@angular-devkit/schematics         9.1.8
@angular/cdk                       9.2.4
@angular/cli                       9.1.8
@angular/material                  9.2.4
@ngtools/webpack                   9.1.8
@schematics/angular                9.1.8
@schematics/update                 0.901.8
ng-packagr                         9.1.5
rxjs                               6.5.5
typescript                         3.7.5
webpack                            4.42.0
**Anything else relevant?** No

Issues.Title: AOT Compiler requires public properties, while non-AOT allows private properties
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request ### Relevant Package This feature request is for @angular/core ### Description A clear and concise description of the problem or missing capability... Here we are, 2 years [later](https://github.com/angular/angular/issues/11978), and the Ivy compiler seems to behave in the same way. Still I can't access private properties in templates (or at least protected). ### Describe the solution you'd like If you have a solution in mind, please describe it. I think the generated class for the View, should extend the factory component class, like this, making it at least possible to access protected properties. ### Describe alternatives you've considered Have you considered any alternative solutions or workarounds? The alternative is very poor. I have to use a `BaseComponent` class, so all my components need to extend this class. Then, in the `BaseComponent` I have a getter, called `view`, like this: ``` export class BaseComponent { public get view(): any { return this; } } ... \@Component( ... template: `
{{view._name}}
... ) export class MyComponent extends BaseComponent { private _name = 'X'; } ``` I think this is not very optimal. Did I miss something? Can Ivy compiler in Angular 9 access the private properties in the components?
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "AOT Compiler requires public properties, while non-AOT allows private properties" (#37660)

Issues.Title: docs: make Name input conform to WCAG 2.1
Issues.Body:
To conform to Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.1, Success Criterion 1.3.5, an input
requesting the user's full name must have an "autocomplete" attribute with the value
"name". See
https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/Understanding/identify-input-purpose.html.
This code‚Äôs details are not explained in the surrounding tutorial, so this code change does
not require any revision in that content.

Issues.Title: Internationalization (i18n) merging already translated files
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request regarding i18n

### Description
Hi all, are you considering some approach regarding i18n translations maintainability. What I mean is:
- what is the best approach when you already have a translated app and for example delete some feature and add new ones to the project. Are you planning some kind of merging between the already translated files and the new incoming sources.


### Solution I'd like
Command which overrides our current translated files which are described in the "angular.json". With the merge it can
- delete unused sources by id
- add the new sources
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Internationalization (i18n) merging already translated files" (#37655)

Issues.Title: Tutorial suggests a change in code, that makes the default tests fail
Issues.Body:
# üìö Docs or angular.io bug report

### Description

When following "Tour of heroes" tutorial, I found out that tutorial suggests a change that immediately makes the tests fail. I found it, because i had `ng test` command running, which turned red immediately after I introduced the change. The tutorial says nothing about the failing tests, nor saying how to fix it.

## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction

### What's the affected URL?**
https://angular.io/tutorial/toh-pt0

### Reproduction Steps**
Follow the "Tour of heroes" tutorial

### Expected vs Actual Behavior**
I would expect that if tutorial suggest to go with `ng new example` (which creates default tests), and also suggests to change the structure of the `app` template, then it should also mention this change in test.

How to fix the tests, so they follow the tutorial:

Change this:
```ts
expect(compiled.querySelector('.content span').textContent).toContain('example app is running');
```
to this:
```ts
expect(compiled.querySelector('h1').textContent).toContain('Tour of Heroes!');
```

## üì∑Screenshot
<!-- Often a screenshot can help to capture the issue better than a long description. -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èupload a screenshot:-->
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/13367735/85204601-de17ac80-b315-11ea-944b-41a20c63787e.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Tutorial suggests a change in code, that makes the default tests fail" (#37652)

Issues.Title: ng serve returns 200 for non-existent files in the assets folder instead of 404 - user gets redirected to the default route
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report - [ ] new - [ ] build - [X] serve - [ ] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Y - Was fixed as part of https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/2989 Currently running Angular CLI 6.1.5 for an Angular 6 project and experiencing the same issues ### Description When running ng serve if an image file doesn't exist eg http://localhost:4200/assets/img/filedoesnotexist.jpg instead of returning a 404 response the @angular-devkit/build-angular:dev-server returns a 200 response and redirects to the '' route I think I need to use a custom builder or if there's another fix I'd love to know but at present it is like the webpack dev server doesn't serve anything in the assets as a static file so it runs through routing The fix appears to force accept HTML headers option to webpack dev server. https://github.com/angular/angular-cli/issues/2989 I have the exact issue where if I request a missing image instead of 404ing it returns 200 and tries to redirect to index.html I was wondering how to use this in my angular.json I'm using angular 6 and CLI version 6.1.5 Or if someone knows of a fix I'd love someone to run up a quick sample project with a few routes and some images and have some assets return 404 ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction To test open the ng-test.zip file: https://www.dropbox.com/s/5f9putxrny4kfrk/ng-test.zip?dl=0 1. Run npm i 2. Run ng serve 3. Navigate to http://localhost:4200/assets/icons/trafficlight.png 4. You'll see the image served 5. Navigate to http://localhost:4200/assets/icons/nonexistentfile.png 6. Instead of a 404 you get routed to the home screen ## üî• Exception or Error ## üåç Your Environment 

Angular CLI 6.1.5

Can also reproduce in Angular CLI: 9.1.9 and subsequent latest packages
**Anything else relevant?** Running "builder": "@angular-devkit/build-angular:dev-server", in angular.json I don't know if the intention of the team is to have people run a custom dev-server instead? I couldn't find anything in the 200 headers returned for a missing asset file to indicate an error or anything it just looks like a normal 200 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1916426/85363814-2d075100-b565-11ea-9dfd-9a8565878281.png) Here's an example of the fact the dev server a non-existent jpg file as html and returns a 200
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "ng serve returns 200 for non-existent files in the assets folder instead of 404 - user gets redirected to the default route" (#17989)

Issues.Title: fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use copy-on-write asset processing for all builds
Issues.Body: Optimized asset processing was only being performed when differential loading was enabled.  This change ensures that the optimized approach is used for all builds.  This does not affect `ng serve` usage since it currently requires all application files to be in memory.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(@angular-devkit/build-angular): use copy-on-write asset processing for all builds" (#17988)

Issues.Title: Error when running schematics unit test
Issues.Body:
This is my first time working in the world of schematics, so it's quite possible I just don't have this set up correctly. But I've been following the guide on angular.io and some additional blog walkthroughs. I'm wanting to package ng-add and ng-update schematics into a component library, that I already have setup and running well. After setting up the initial plumbing for the ng-add one, I wrote a simple unit test just to validate the setup and as soon as it hits the call to new SchematicTestRunner, it blows up with a ton of Module not found errors, including child_process and fs. In fact i commented out everything in the unit test except the creation of the test runner, just to identify the breaking point. And the schematic itself isn't doing anything yet except returning the tree as-is. Interestingly, the "blank" schematics project doesn't use ng test at all, but instead uses jasmine directly. But with this being in an existing Angular Library with full test suite, i wanted to test in the same way. Any help with this, would be much appreciated! # üêû Bug report ### Command (mark with an `x`) - [ ] new - [ ] build - [ ] serve - [x] test - [ ] e2e - [ ] generate - [ ] add - [ ] update - [ ] lint - [ ] xi18n - [ ] run - [ ] config - [ ] help - [ ] version - [ ] doc ### Is this a regression? Issues.Title: [patch] ci: fix dedupe-duplicate-modules flakes
Issues.Body:
Following #17973, which we emitted the stderr when this test failed on CI.

We see that the resolved module order sometimes changes, which is totally fine because of the async nature of the operation.

https://circleci.com/gh/angular/angular-cli/167318#tests/containers/5
```
[DedupeModuleResolvePlugin]: /tmp/angular-cli-e2e-i03vMQ/test-project/node_modules/tslib-1 -> /tmp/angular-cli-e2e-i03vMQ/test-project/node_modules/tslib-1-copy
```

With this change we handle both cases which should eliminate the flakes

(cherry picked from commit bf599e4fac433c0b7041b5fac72d10a1677070cc)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "[patch] ci: fix dedupe-duplicate-modules flakes" (#17984)

Issues.Title: `ng add` installs old package versions in 10.0.0-rc.5
Issues.Body:
# üêû Bug report ### Command - [x] add ### Is this a regression? Yes, the previous version in which this bug was not present was v9.1.9 ### Description `ng add` installs old versions instead of `latest`. Managed to reproduce it with both `@kendo-angular-buttons` (installs v0.10.1) and `@angular/material` (installs v7.3.7). ## üî¨ Minimal Reproduction 1. `npm install -g @angular/cli@next` 1. `ng new ng10-project --defaults --skip-git` 1. `cd ng10-project` 1. `ng add @progress/kendo-angular-buttons` The problem **does not occur** if we specify a version to be installed, e.g. `ng add @progress/kendo-angular-buttons@latest` ## üî• Exception or Error 

The package that you are trying to add does not support schematics. You can try using a different version of the package or contact the package author to add ng-add support.

Issues.Title: GraphQL support
Issues.Body:
<!--üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ

Oh hi there! üòÑ

To expedite issue processing please search open and closed issues before submitting a new one.
Existing issues often contain information about workarounds, resolution, or progress updates.

üîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖüîÖ-->


# üöÄ Feature request


### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [x] build
- [ ] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description

GraphQL support in Angular CLI is extremely limited or rather non existent. The big trouble for anyone trying to use Angular and GraphQL is that there is no way of pre-compile GraphQL documents. This way we end up with an extremely oversized bundles and increased script initialization.

There are solutions out there that compile GraphQL document into an AST:
- [`graphql-tag/loader`](https://github.com/apollographql/graphql-tag#webpack-loading-and-preprocessing)
- [`babel-plugin-graphql-tag`](https://github.com/gajus/babel-plugin-graphql-tag)
- [`ts-transform-graphql-tag`](https://github.com/firede/ts-transform-graphql-tag)
- [`rollup-plugin-graphql`](https://github.com/Kocal/rollup-plugin-graphql)

None of the solutions listed above can be used effectively if we intend to develop library containing GraphQL.
With application alone we could theoretically make it work with `graphql-tag/loader`. Adding library into the mix will simply not work, as `ng-packagr` is completely closed to any custom Rollup loaders.

Similar `ng-packagr` issue: https://github.com/ng-packagr/ng-packagr/issues/1619

Disclamer: I know the main issue is in `ng-packagr`, but I wanted to see what is the overall Angular CLI take on this, since Angular CLI is "blocked" by it indirectly.

### Describe the solution you'd like

If the GraphQL is big enough in Angular it could become first class citizen.
If not (probably not), we would need some convenient way of adding loaders for both applications **and** libraries, as covering applications alone is only half of the story.

I know `ng-packagr` is a complete separate project, but that is exactly the problem here. While Angular CLI is getting more open with public APIs, `ng-packagr` is as closed as ever.

### Describe alternatives you've considered

The only alternative I can think of is a fork of `ng-packagr` and a custom Angular CLI packagr builder to handle this not so special case. Either that or a complete abandonment of Angular CLI.

Issues.Title: Make ng-serve Also Serve 3rdpartylicenses.txt
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ Feature request
### Command (mark with an `x`)
<!-- Can you pin-point the command or commands that are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: -->
- [ ] new
- [ ] build
- [x] serve
- [ ] test
- [ ] e2e
- [ ] generate
- [ ] add
- [ ] update
- [ ] lint
- [ ] xi18n
- [ ] run
- [ ] config
- [ ] help
- [ ] version
- [ ] doc

### Description
Currently `ng build` can generate the `3rdpartylicenses.txt`, which is great, but `ng serve` isn't able to serve the `3rdpartylicenses.txt`. This is a bit inconvenient as a website may wish to use the file on a `/licenses` page to display all third-party licenses that were used. Everything is there to make this for production, but not a simple means to test it in development without hosting a mock `3rdpartylicenses.txt` somewhere and loading that instead.


### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Could an option be provided to generate and serve the 3rd party licenses files along with the rest of the application in `ng serve`.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Make ng-serve Also Serve 3rdpartylicenses.txt" (#17965)

Issues.Title: 3rdpartylicenses.txt In Additional Formats
Issues.Body:
# üöÄ feature request

### Relevant Package
<!-- Can you pin-point one or more @angular/* packages the are relevant for this feature request? -->
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏èedit: --> This feature request is for @angular/core


### Description
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Currently the 3rdpartylicenses.txt is generated perfectly fine, and is easy to embed into a web page, however when many libraries are in use the output can be a bit clunky and long, it's not the most user-friendly way to display licenses and a lot can be done to make it more presentable to an end user should they bother to check it out.

### Describe the solution you'd like
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> Could a way be provided to provide the license information as a JSON array instead.

#### Standard
```
@angular-devkit/build-angular
MIT
The MIT License

Copyright (c) 2017 Google, Inc.

Permission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy
of this software and associated documentation files (the "Software"), to deal
in the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights
to use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell
copies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is
furnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:

The above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all
copies or substantial portions of the Software.

THE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED "AS IS", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR
IMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,
FITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE
AUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER
LIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM,
OUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE
SOFTWARE.


@angular/animations
MIT
```

#### Potential JSON Version
```json
[
  {
    "package": "@angular-devkit/build-angular",
    "license": "MIT",
    "content": "The MIT License\n\nCopyright (c) 2017 Google, Inc.\n\nPermission is hereby granted, free of charge, to any person obtaining a copy\nof this software and associated documentation files (the \"Software\"), to deal\nin the Software without restriction, including without limitation the rights\nto use, copy, modify, merge, publish, distribute, sublicense, and/or sell\ncopies of the Software, and to permit persons to whom the Software is\nfurnished to do so, subject to the following conditions:\n\nThe above copyright notice and this permission notice shall be included in all\ncopies or substantial portions of the Software.\n\nTHE SOFTWARE IS PROVIDED \"AS IS\", WITHOUT WARRANTY OF ANY KIND, EXPRESS OR\nIMPLIED, INCLUDING BUT NOT LIMITED TO THE WARRANTIES OF MERCHANTABILITY,\nFITNESS FOR A PARTICULAR PURPOSE AND NONINFRINGEMENT. IN NO EVENT SHALL THE\nAUTHORS OR COPYRIGHT HOLDERS BE LIABLE FOR ANY CLAIM, DAMAGES OR OTHER\nLIABILITY, WHETHER IN AN ACTION OF CONTRACT, TORT OR OTHERWISE, ARISING FROM,\nOUT OF OR IN CONNECTION WITH THE SOFTWARE OR THE USE OR OTHER DEALINGS IN THE\nSOFTWARE."
  },
  {
    "package": "@angular-devkit/build-angular",
    "license": "MIT"
  }
]
```

This would provide much finer control of how the content can be displayed to users, ie using showing each license separately with an [Expansion Panels](https://material.angular.io/components/expansion/overview) or `<details>` HTML tag.

If for legal reasons, it's desirable to always output `3rdpartylicenses.txt`, that's perfectly fine, it'd be nice to just have the `3rdpartylicenses.json` _in addition_, so that the website can serve a text version which can be viewed or downloaded as per normal, but also a JSON version which allows a custom component to be created to display it well.

This could _optionally_ be further expanded by including things like the NPM URL if public/available, GitHub URL if it's visible on NPM, version in use, funding URL if they're seeking funding, etc.

### Describe alternatives you've considered
<!-- ‚úçÔ∏è--> One could possibly make their own component which reads and parses the `.txt` file manually into an appropriate JSON object and then present it themselves, this would be limited but functional. 

I think providing it this the suggested way would be best however as it's the most expansive and if it's feasible to include package data like version and if it's seeking funding, allows these to be obtained easily at compile time.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "3rdpartylicenses.txt In Additional Formats" (#17970)

Issues.Title: refactor(form-field): use lightweight token for optimized treeshaking
Issues.Body:
Currently the `MatFormField` always retains `MatHint`, `MatError`,
`MatPrefix` and `MatSuffix`. These are optional parts of a form-field so
we ideally would not retain those always.

We can achieve this by using lightweight injection tokens for querying
of these directives, instead of using the actual implementations as
query predicate token. The retention was already an issue in View Engine
too, but the issue became more noticeable in Ivy where factories and
definitions are directly attached to the classes.

In the basic case this signifies a reduction of ~800kb, while in the advanced
case (due to the referenced injection tokens), we increase by ~300kb.

Related to #19576
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor(form-field): use lightweight token for optimized treeshaking " (#19714)

Issues.Title: bug(CDK/SCROLLING): *cdkVirtualFor causes Property '' does not exist on type 'unknown' with Angular 9 strictTemplates enabled using slice pipe
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

Stackblitz can't reproduce an issue with the compiler, so I have uploaded a reproduction repo to github.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Download https://github.com/jahumes/slice-pipe-scrolling-strict-templates
2. Install packages
3. Run npm or yarn start
4. Should see the below errors
```
ERROR in src/app/app.component.html:13:57 - error TS2339: Property 'id' does not exist on type 'unknown'.
    
    13                 (click)="organizationClick(organization.id)">
                                                               ~~
    
      src/app/app.component.ts:9:16
        9   templateUrl: './app.component.html',
                         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
        Error occurs in the template of component AppComponent.
    src/app/app.component.html:14:28 - error TS2339: Property 'id' does not exist on type 'unknown'.
    
    14             {{organization.id}}
                                  ~~
    
      src/app/app.component.ts:9:16
        9   templateUrl: './app.component.html',
                         ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
        Error occurs in the template of component AppComponent.
```
5. If you remove the pipe (uncomment line 9 from app.component.html), there are no errors in the console. Also, if you keep the slice pipe and comment out lines 1 and 18 and change the `*cdkVirtualFor` on line 2 to an `*ngFor`, then the errors go away. 
6. The issue comes when `strictTemplates` is enabled in the tsconfig.json. If it is false, then the errors go a way

#### Expected Behavior

This should not be returning an error.


#### Environment

- Angular: 9.1.11
- CDK/Material: 9.2.4
- Browser(s): In compiler so all of them
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): macOS 10.15.5
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(CDK/SCROLLING): *cdkVirtualFor causes Property '' does not exist on type 'unknown' with Angular 9 strictTemplates enabled using slice pipe" (#19716)

I am using the `<mat-tab-group>` with `mat-tab` element and I can navigate through my list of tabs using the arrows. Is there a way to move all the visible tabs on a single arrow click?

Issues.Title: bug(cdk/testing): harnesses treat tabs different depending on test environment
Issues.Body:
#### Reproduction

https://travis-ci.org/github/e-hein/test-tabkey/branches

* without tab everything works as expected: last-working-sample-without-tab  
([build log](https://travis-ci.org/github/e-hein/test-tabkey/builds/700348184)|[stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/github/e-hein/test-tabkey/tree/last-working-sample-without-tab?file=src%2Ftesting%2Fapp.shared-spec.ts))

* using tab will lead to different behavior: broken-by-using-the-tab-key  
([build log](https://travis-ci.org/github/e-hein/test-tabkey/builds/700352857)|[changes](https://github.com/e-hein/test-tabkey/commit/7bce9aee0202080a0b7fd185c795f7552f7f9b15)|[stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/github/e-hein/test-tabkey/tree/broken-by-using-the-tab-key?file=src%2Ftesting%2Fapp.shared-spec.ts)) 
 
* workaround: workaround-with-emulate-tab  
([build log](https://travis-ci.org/github/e-hein/test-tabkey/builds/700382043)|[changes](https://github.com/e-hein/test-tabkey/commit/1606813a35262dda560c366d7043c67ca0bf982a)|[stackblitz](https://stackblitz.com/github/e-hein/test-tabkey/tree/workaround-with-emulate-tab?file=src%2Ftesting%2Fapp.harness.ts))

#### Expected Behavior
If I can switch from karma/jest to protractor I'd expect the same harness test to lead to the same results. In this case, I'd expected that senden ```TestKey.Tab``` to an ```TestElement``` it should select the next selectable element (or at least try to do so in the most common cases).

##### Alternative Behavior
Sending ```TestKey.Tab``` writes a \t into an input field in both environments.

#### Actual Behavior
* Sending ```TestKey.Tab``` in ProtractorEnvironment selects the next input (=expected Behavior)
* Sending ```TestKey.Tab``` in TestbedEnvironment does nothing (not even write \t)

#### Environment
- Angular: 9.1.9
- CDK/Material: cdk 9.2.4, material 9.2.4
- Browser(s): Chrome, Firefox
- Operating System (e.g. Windows, macOS, Ubuntu): 
Angular CLI: 9.1.9
Node: 12.18.0
OS: darwin x64 / Linux
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "bug(cdk/testing): harnesses treat tabs different depending on test environment" (#19709)

Issues.Title: fix(select): have form control disabled state take precedence over disabled binding
Issues.Body:
`MatSelect` can be disabled either through the `disabled` property or via a `ControlValueAccessor`, but currently it's inconsistent if the two values conflict with each other since we take the value of the last one that was set. These changes make it so that the value from the CVA has precedence. This is consistent with how we handle the disabled state in `MatInput`.

Fixes #19437.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "fix(select): have form control disabled state take precedence over disabled binding" (#19705)

Issues.Title: refactor(material-experimental): expose whether harness elements are focused

Currently we have a bunch of test harnesses that have methods for blurring and focusing the underlying element, but they don't expose whether it currently has focus. These changes add `isFocused` methods to all of the harnesses so they're consistent between each other.

Fixes #19702.

Issues.Title: feat(material/chips): prevent chips from being deleted when user holds backspace
Issues.Body:
* By default, while holding backspace when the input is focused and empty, the last chip (if exists) would be focused.
* This makes is so that when people delete the content they wrote, they will eventually start deleting chips.
* This PR makes it so that only after the user releases the backspace after deleting all the content, subsequent backspace presses will focus the chips.

Edge Cases:
- [x] BS on initial empty input should focus last chip.
- [x] BS on initial non-empty input should not focus last chip (and not created new one due to focus out).
- [x] BS after changing input (from empty state or otherwise) should not focus last input or create chip.
- [ ] BS after creating new chip should focus last input.

**Todo: Add unit tests!**

Fixes: #18659
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "feat(material/chips): prevent chips from being deleted when user holds backspace" (#19700)

Issues.Title: refactor: use lightweight token for chip avatar, remove and trailing icon
Issues.Body:
Currently `MatChip` always causes `MatChipAvatar`, `MatChipRemove` and
`MatChipTrailingIcon` to be retained. These are optional parts of a chip and
shouldn't be retained always. The retention of these classes wasn't noticeable
in View Engine as no factories were generated for directives. With Ivy though,
factories and definitions are generated for these directives and a size increase
is noticeable.

We should use lightweight tokens for querying of those directives. These tokens
can be considered a reference to the actual directives. That allows us to query
for these directives in content queries, or DI without the risk of retaining the
full classes w/ factories/definitions attached. 

That helps with the case where not all of the optional chip parts are used. If all
parts are used, the app will slightly increase due to the provided injection tokens,
but that is of ~150b, while the savings are of ~800b in the common case. The size
benefit is even more noticeable in the MDC-based implementation of chips
as the directives contain a lot more logic w/ MDC foundations.

Related to: #19576
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "refactor: use lightweight token for chip avatar, remove and trailing icon" (#19693)
